intro: Randia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Randia triflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
